meaning_str.bing:
v. 欣赏；感谢；感激；升值
网络. 赏识；鉴赏；增值

感激；感谢；欣赏；赏识；欢迎；重视；珍惜；理解；领会；意识到；认识到；升值；增值；涨价；提高价值；增长（价值）；提升（价值）

1.en: I was just about to call to tell you how I appreciate the flowers you sent me.
1.cn: 我正要打电话告诉你，你送的花我真是太喜欢了。

2.en: He knew how much we loved the place and that we'd appreciate the years of work he and his wife had put into their home.
2.cn: 他知道我们有多麽喜欢他们的房子，也知道我们欣赏他和太太多年来花在房子上的心血。

3.en: Not only will your date appreciate it but you will discover how much better you feel mentally, physically and emotionally.
3.cn: 这样，你不单会珍惜你的每次约会，你也将发现你从精神上、生理上和情感上都感觉如此美妙。

0.en: Your parents would appreciate that about, now.
0.cn: 你们的父母此时会很欣赏这种做法。

1.en: While I appreciate your folksy tire wisdom, I don't appreciate what you're putting Mom through.
1.cn: 虽然我挺欣赏你的民间轮胎箴言，但我并不欣赏你让妈遭受的事。

2.en: I mean, grandma says that there's value in just one thing, that you appreciate it more because there's just one.
2.cn: 奶奶说一件东西才有价值，因为你会因它的独一无二而欣赏它。

3.en: All this time, I've been trying to love and appreciate her, but all it took was this big, hunking rock.
3.cn: 这么久以来我都试图爱她，欣赏她，但只需要一个大钻石就能打动她。

4.en: It wasn't that the music was lacking, it was my ability to appreciate it and to hear it in the right way.
4.cn: 问题不在于音乐不够好，而在于我没有能力去欣赏，是我听的方式不对。

5.en: You think I'm a corporate asshole, that I don't appreciate pop culture, but, man, that's not true.
5.cn: 你觉得我就是个开公司的混蛋，完全不会欣赏流行文化，但是，小伙子，事实并非如此。

6.en: I see hope. I see a unique voice who's learned to appreciate the influence of hope. Try not to lose that. I won't.
6.cn: 我看到了希望，我看到了一个独特的声音，她学会了欣赏希望的影响，不要丢了这一点。我不会、

7.en: That is apt and amusing. I think I shall share that with Amy Farrah Fowler. She'll appreciate the witticism. Thank you.
7.cn: 这观点真是聪明又有趣，我应该跟艾米·菲拉·福勒分享，她一定会欣赏你的妙语连珠。不敢当。

8.en: To fully appreciate the humiliation of being a Basketboy you need to know that the chosen few are auctioned off in front of the student body to the highest-bidding females.
8.cn: 要欣赏篮子男孩遭到羞辱的盛况，你要知道被选中的男孩要当着所有同学的面被拍卖给出价最高的女生。

9.en: But at some point, I not only began to be able to appreciate the music but I started being able to contribute to it and create my own fresh spins on the tried-and-true.
9.cn: 但从某一刻开始，我不仅能够欣赏这种音乐，而且我开始能够贡献于它，在实践当中贡献我自己的新鲜血液。

10.en: Let's say you spend your life doing solid scientific research surrounded by friends and loved ones who appreciate you, not for what you've accomplished but for who you are as a man.
10.cn: 假设你这辈子一直在做踏实的科学研究你身边全是朋友和爱你的人他们欣赏你，不是因为你的成就而是因为你这个人。

11.en: OK, the reason I think that the argument holds water though is because that's exactly what I went through, so I happen to know a thing or two about learning to appreciate Chinese pop as a Westerner.
11.cn: 好，我认为这个理由站得住脚，因为这正是我经历过的，所以我恰好对西方人如何学习欣赏中文流行歌曲略知一二。

12.en: But the other side of the argument I think is more interesting and thought provoking and even more true that Western ears aren't familiar with and therefore don't really understand how to appreciate Chinese music.
12.cn: 但是问题还有另一面，我认为是更有趣的，更有挑战性的，而且是更真实的，那就是西方人的耳朵对它不熟悉，因而不了解应该如何欣赏中国音乐。

13.en: All right, picture this: a beautiful outdoor concert. Now, as a human, I appreciate Beethoven. As a fungus, I have a terrific view, growing out of a towering maple tree. And no thank you, expensive concessions. Because as an algae, I'll just snack on this sun light.
13.cn: 没问题，试想一下：一场高雅的户外音乐会，作为人类，我能够欣赏贝多芬的音乐；作为菌类，我能够沿着耸立的枫树生长，以获得最棒的视野；我也无需花钱买高昂的酒水，因为作为藻类，我以光合作用维生。

15.cn: 谢谢你，杰克，真的很感谢。

16.en: We appreciate anything you can tell us.
16.cn: 好吧，你们说的一切我们都很感激。

17.en: I'd appreciate you thinking about it, okay?
17.cn: 我觉得你还是考虑一下，好吗？

18.en: I appreciate that. You're a good maid of honor.
18.cn: 谢谢。你真是一个好伴娘。

19.en: Well, thank you. Thank you. We appreciate that.
